definition: to leave behind (inadvertently)/to forget/to omit/to leave out
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: Are you hiding away, lost Under the sewers.
sentences.chinese: 你不断的在躲藏吗，是遗落在阴沟之下。

sentences.english: I'm holding in my hand an earring you once lost.
sentences.chinese: 我正将你遗落的耳环握在手里。

sentences.english: Is it the tear that you dropped in previous existence?
sentences.chinese: 那，可是你前世遗落的冰泪一滴？

sentences.english: We eyed it, the dropped kerchief of time.
sentences.chinese: 我们注视着它，这遗落的时光的帕子。

sentences.english: After time past, we found many things has lossed, and many chooses were wrong.
sentences.chinese: 匆匆走过，你发现许多东西被遗落，许多选择出了错。

sentences.english: Lamb sold, but there is sheep offal left behind in the pan.
sentences.chinese: 羊肉卖了，但总有些羊杂碎遗落在锅里。

sentences.english: Touch my heart lost for a long time desolate, humming.
sentences.chinese: 抚摸心头的荒芜，哼唱内心遗落许久的感伤。

sentences.english: And it will be as when one gleans the ears In the valley of Rephaim.
sentences.chinese: 又像人在利乏音谷拾取遗落的穗子。

definition: to disappear without trace/to vanish all of a sudden/to spread fast/to spread like wildfire
to cover up/to conceal/to go into hiding
to return/to give back/to send back/to repatriate
to deposit/to store/to leave sth with sb
to float down/to fall gently (snowflakes, leaves etc)
